post.description:
• Invoke this API to create a new user.
  • Only system administrator or users with user management rights can invoke this API.
  • Specifying 'ServiceUser' will override the 'InEveryBodyRole' property if both are provided.
  • Refer guides section Create a User

SendSmsInvite.description: Send user an sms invite to enroll their mobile device in the protal (default=false)

InSysAdminRole.description: Place user in System Adminstrator role (default=false)

Name.description: Username of the user. The username can be 'username@suffix if suffix is required, else 'username'. The username can be optional only when Primary Identifier is provided. Ex: mark@aak7163

MobileNumber.description: User's mobile number (default=null); note this field is required if SendSmsInvite is true

useAlternateMfaAccount.description: Does the user have an alternate MFA Account?

OrgPath.description: The organisation name to which the user is added

Password.description: Strong password of the user that meets the complexity requirements. Password must be at least 8 characters long, not be longer than 64 characters, contain at least one digit, contain at least one upper and one lower case letter. (default=randomly generated strong password)

CmaRedirectedUserUuid.description: Unique id of the redirected user.

ReportsTo.description: Uuid of user this user reports to (default=null)

SendEmailInvite.description: Send user an email invite to login to the portal. (default=true)

VerifyEmail.description: Enforce user to verify the registered email address

ForcePasswordChangeNext.description: Force password change at first login (default=true)

Mail.description: Email address of user; Note this field is required if 'SendEmailInvite' is true, or 'VerifyEmail' is true. Ex: mark@yahoo.com

post.description:
• Use this API to initiate the bulk user import in the CyberArk Identity cloud directory.
  • Only system administrators and users with user management rights can invoke this API.
  • This API is the first part of the two API calls to upload a bulk of users in the cloud directory. Refer to SubmitUploadedFile for the second part, which performs the actual upload.
  • This API takes a CSV file containing the users' information for bulk import and the file name as form-data in request.
  • When this API is invoked, the list of users and their information will be read from the CSV file sent as a request to this API, and the Identity cloud will store the file in the cloud storage and returns a ReturnID that contains the formatted name of the CSV.
  • The CSV file will be validated to ensure the data is correct in the CSV file, and validation errors are thrown if the information is not correctly formatted.

parameters.name: importType
parameters.description: Bulk import type to process. Default type is Bulk User Import i.e. "ImportBulkUser"

File_Name.description: The csv file containing user information

SendSmsInvite.description: Send user an SMS invite to enroll their mobile device in the portal (default=false)

InSysAdminRole.description: Place user in System Adminstrator role (default=false)

MobileNumber.description: User's mobile number (default=null); note this field is required if SendSmsInvite is true

Password.description: URL encoded password of the user (default=randomly generated strong password)

CmaRedirectedUserUuid.description: Idaptive mobile authenticator redirected user uuid

ReportsTo.description: Uuid of user this user reports to (default=null)

SendEmailInvite.description: Send user an email invite to the portal (default=true)

ForcePasswordChangeNext.description: Force password change at first login (default=true)

Mail.description: Email of user (default=null); note this field is required if 'SendEmailInvite' is true

FileName.description: The CSV file name that contains a list of users and related data to be read to import. Ex: bulkImportUserTemplate.csv

post.description:
• Use this API to create users in bulk in the CyberArk Identity cloud directory.
  • Only system administrators and users with user management rights can invoke this API.
  • This API is the second part of the two API calls to upload a bulk of users in the cloud directory. Refer to GetUsersFromCsvFile for the first part, which initiates the import.
  • This API creates a scheduled task to process the uploaded CSV file containing the users information for the bulk import and creation.
  • When this API is invoked, admin submits the file uploaded to cloud for bulk user import.
  • This API request takes a query parameter 'importType' which should be 'ImportBulkUser' in this particular case.
  • In request body, the email address of the admin making the import and the returnId from preceeding API call are mandatory to be passed.

parameters.name: importType
parameters.description: Bulk import type to process. Default type is Bulk User Import i.e. "ImportBulkUser"

ReturnID.description: Return id recieved in response from preceeding API call '/GetUsersFromCsvFile'

AdminEmail.description: Email address of the admin or user with user management rights whois trying to create these users on the cloud

SendSmsInvite.description: Indicate if you want to send all the users created via this API an sms invite to enroll their mobile device in the portal

SendEmailInvite.description: Indicate if you want to send all the users created via this API an email invite to the portal

post.description: You must be a system administrator or have user management permissions.

SmsInvite.description: Send SMS invitations to invited entities if possible (default=false)

Entities.description: Users or groups to invite; each entry is a dictionary including 'Type' (User, Group, Role), 'Guid' (entity UUID), and 'Name' (entity name, only applicable to User entities)

Role.description: Add each invited user to this role name if specified (default=null)

GroupInvite.description: For invited groups, send a single email invitation to the group rather than to each user within the group (default=true)

EmailInvite.description: Send email invitations to invited entities if possible (default=true)

post.description: You must be a system administrator.

ID.description: List of user UUIDs to send invitations to

post.description: You must be a system administrator or have user management permissions.

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: User UUID to send invitation to

post.description:
• Use this API to fetch the details of any specific existing user in the cloud directory.
  • Only system administrators, users with user management rights, or the user itself can invoke this API.
  • This API is a GET request that needs the desired user's unique id as parameters in the body arguments.
  • Only system admin or users with user management permission can execute this API to get the details of other cloud users.
  • Standard users can fetch only their details using this API call.
  • The API call returns the ID, name and various details for the requested user.

ID.description: The Unique Id of the Cloud user to fetch. The unique ID is generated when the user is created. Ex: abc-e2e-123

post.description:
• Invoke this API to get the user information for a given user.
  • Only system administrator, users with user management rights, or the user itself can invoke this API.
  • NOTE: This is a high CPU intensive call, so it should be used appropriately. (Cache the result as needed).

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The unique ID of the user to fetch attributes for. The unique ID is generated when the user is created.(default=current user)

post.description: Specified user must be you, you must be a system administrator, or have user management permissions.

username.description: User name of the cloud user to fetch (default=current user).

post.description:
• Use this API to fetch the list with details of all existing users in the cloud directory.
  • Only system administrators and users with user management rights can invoke this API.
  • This API is a simple GET request which doesn't need any parameters in the body arguments.
  • Only system admin or any user with user management permission can execute this to get a successful response with a list of all cloud users.
  • The API call returns the ID, name and various details for all users present in the cloud directory.
  • Before adding a new user, you can determine whether the user already exists by calling this API.

• Invoke this API to update the information for the specified user.
  • User must be a cloud user.
  • Only system administrator, users with user management rights, or the user itself can invoke this API.
  • Specifying 'ServiceUser' will override the 'InEveryBodyRole' property if both are provided.
  • Refer guides section Update User Information

CmaRedirectedUserUuid.description: Idaptive mobile authenticator redirected user unique id.

useAlternateMfaAccount.description: Does the user have an alternate MFA Account?

OrgPath.description: The organisation name to which the user is added

ReportsTo.description: Unique Id of the user to whom the user reports.

ID.description: Unique Id of the cloud user to change. Ex: a3e5bab3-9104-49cb-9d3a-e5da7gcef3a3

ForcePasswordChangeNext.description: Should the user change password on first login?

InEverybodyRole.description: Is user in the Everybody role?

VerifyEmail.description: Enforce user to verify the registered email address

Name.description: Username of the user. The username can be 'username@suffix' if suffix is required, else 'username'.

post.description:
• Use this API to update an existing cloud user properties.
  • Only system administrators, users with user management rights, or the user itself can invoke this API.
  • The profile information includes username, email address, display name, mobile number, etc.
  • The user for which update is made must be a cloud user.
  • This API updates also additional attributes which are present in the system.
  • All the parameters other than those mentioned in the body args are treated as additional attributes.

DisplayName.description: Name of the the user, suitable for display to end users

ID.description: The Unique Id of the Cloud user to update. The unique ID is generated when the user is created.

MobileNumber.description: Mobile phone number of the user

VerifyEmail.description: Enforce user to verify the registered email address

Mail.description: Email address of the user. Note this field is required if either mobile number is not provided or 'SendEmailInvite' is true, or Identity Verification has to be done, or VerifyEmail is true

Description.description: Can provide some information related to the user.

Name.description: This is the name of the user which must be of the form 'name@suffix', not contain restricted characters, and must match an existing User Service suffix. Format:username@suffix. You must be a system administrator or have user management permissions to change this field.

post.description:
This API is used to update the value of different attributes for an CyberArk Identity active directory users.
  - System administrators and users with user management rights, or the user itself can invoke this API.
  - To update multiple attributes add them in the request body and make the update call with this API.
  - Use this endpoint to set the active directory user attributes from cloud.
  - The JSON in the request body must include the unique id of the target active directory user.

CmaRedirectedUserUuid.description: Unique id of the user account that you want to redirect multi-factor authentication to. Send null to remove existing the value.

ID.description: Unique id of the target user.

MobileNumber.description: User's mobile number (default=null). This field is required if SendSmsInvite is true.

OrgPath.description: The organization name (default=null) that you want to add the user to.

post.summary: Get user roles and administrative rights
post.description:
• This API is used to show a list of user roles and administrative rights associated with the roles.
  • Only system administrators, users with user management rights can invoke this API.
  • In response, it will return userid along with associated administrative rights.

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The unique ID of the user to fetch administrative rights

Limit.description: The maximum number of results to return for the specified page.

PageNumber.description: The number of pages of results to return.

PageSize.description: The number of entities to return per page.

Caching.description:
Can be set to the following values:
  • -1: returns live data but writes to the cache for query results.
  • <-1: don't read from or write to the cache for query results.
  • 0: use the cache for both read/write with 'caching in minutes as TTL of the results.

SortBy.description: Comma-separated list of column names to sort by.

post.description:
• Use this API to set a user picture/photo for a particular user.
  • Only system administrators, users with user management rights, or the user itself can invoke this API.
  • In Response, the attached picture/photo will be set for a particular user

File.description: File containing the users picture, in the form-data.  (Not as a parameter.)

post.summary: Fetch attributes for a specified user.
post.description: Attributes will vary depending on the type of the directory service the user belongs to.

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: User UUID to fetch attributes for (default=current user)

parameters.name: directoryServiceUuid
parameters.description: Directory service UUID of the user (default=null)

post.description:
• Use this API to obtain a list of the current attributes(columns) for a table in the Tenant's extended schema.
  • Only system administrators, users with user management rights, or the user itself can invoke this API.
  • When a user invokes this API for a given table, the list of all extensible attributes present in the table, along with their details, is returned.
  • This API is necessary because all existing attributes must be included when adding/updating the Tenant schema.
  • For more details, please refer to Use extensible attributes.

Table.description: Name of the table to examine

post.description:
• This API is used to get the list of all the current attributes and their values for a CyberArk Identity user.
  • Only system administrators, users with user management rights, or the user itself can invoke this API.
  • When this API is invoked for a user, the list of all extensible attributes set for that particular user with their respective values is returned.
  • Extended unset attributes (i.e., null values) for the user in this request are not returned in the response unless specified in the API request using parameter 'IncludeNulls'.
  • For more details, please refer to Use extensible attributes.

ID.description: ID of the user to fetch list of attributes

IncludeNulls.description: Include columns with null values or not

Table.description: Name of the table to fetch the attributes from

post.description:
• This API is used to update the extended attribute values for a CyberArk Identity user.
  • Only system administrators, users with user management rights, or the user itself can invoke this API.
  • When this API is invoked for the user along with the attribute name and new value, this value replaces the old one in the tenant.
  • The attribute value can be a string, date, boolean, double, or integer and must match the column definition.
  • To clear an attribute's value, we can set it to null.
  • For more details, please refer to Use extensible attributes.

Columns.description: A list of extended columns to update

PhoneNumber.description: A column's new value which needs to be set

ID.description: User ID of the user to set the attributes for

Table.description: Name of the table to modify attributes

post.description:
• This API is used to add new attributes to the tenant schema or edit/update an existing attribute in the schema.
  • Only system administrators can invoke this API.
  • To add multiple attributes to an empty schema, add them to the list and make the update call with this API.
  • To add a single attribute to a schema that already has attributes, use the GetSchema endpoint to get a list of attributes currently in the schema, add the new attribute to the list, and then call this API with the updated complete list.
  • The JSON in the request body must include all current attributes in the schema plus the new attributes.
  • For more details refer to User attributes using API.

Columns.description: A list of extended columns to update

Description.description: Description of data stored in the column

AllowDelete.description: Delete columns which do not exist in updated columns

Table.description: Name of the table to modify

post.description:
You must be a system administrator or have user management permissions.  Will delete cloud users.  Users for other directory services are only removed from the cloud.
            This API will fail if any of the ids specified are the current user.

Users.description: List of user UUIDs to send invitations to

post.description:
• Invoke this API when you want to change the user state from disabled to active or vice versa
  • Only system administrator, users with user management rights, or the user itself can invoke this API.
  • The API will fail, if the user itself will try to change its user state.

uuid.description: The unique ID of the user. The unique ID is generated when the user is created

state.description: Boolean value to change the user state. True = Active and False = Suspended

post.description:
• CyberArk Identity provides this API to lock, disable, or set a Cloud Directory account to expired.
  • Only system administrator and users with user management permissions, can invoke this API.
  • Specified new state may either be 'None' or include one or more of the following values (comma separated): Locked, Disabled, or Expired.
  • For example to lock an account, after too many failed logins, make a call with state as "Expired".
  • You can reenable a locked account by setting the state to "None".

ID.description: Unique id of the cloud user to change the state for

state.description: New state of the user to set. The states available are None, Locked, Disabled or Expired

post.description: You must be a system administrator or have user management permissions or user may be checking for him/herself.

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: The name or uuid of the user to check.

post.summary: Check if user is locked out by policy
post.description:
• Use this API to check if a user can answer the MFA challenges and authenticates itself against CyberArk Identity.
  • Only system administrators, users with user management rights, or the user itself can invoke this API.
  • The user id of the user is passed as query parameter to the API request.
  • Pass an empty string to test the currently logged-in user.
  • Note that only administrative users can test other users.
  • The server returns True if the user is locked out (i.e. cannot answer MFA challenges) and false otherwise.

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: The name or unique id of the user to test. Pass an empty string to test the currently logged-in user. Note that users with administrative rights can test other users

post.description:
• Invoke this API if you want to lock the user account of a given user
  • Only system administrator, users with user management rights, or the user itself can invoke this API.

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: The unique ID of the user. The unique ID is generated when the user is created.

parameters.name: lockUser
parameters.description: This parameter specifies if the user account should be locked or not.The default value is 'false'.

post.description: You must be a system administrator or have user management permissions.  User is exempt from MFA login for a specified amount of time.

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: User UUID to except from MFA

parameters.name: timespan
parameters.description: Amount of time to exempt the user from MFA (default=10 minutes)

post.description: You must be a system administrator or have user management permissions.

post.summary: Get Risk Level for a specified user
post.description:
• This API enables you to fetch the details of an existing user in the Cloud Directory.
  • It retrieves the latest risky event of a user and the point-in-time risk generated by the system.
  • Only system administrators with user management rights can invoke this API.
  • To fetch the Cloud Directory, enter the user’s unique ID as an input parameter in the request body.

ID.description: This is the user unique ID of the user that is generated when the user is created. This ID is used to fetch the user’s attributes from the Cloud Directory.

value.Message: The user with the specified UUID is not found. The user ID may have been deleted or the directory may be unavailable.
value.MessageID: The message ID is a unique identifier for the failure response.
value.Exception: No additional diagnostic information is available.
value.ErrorID: The error ID is a unique identifier for a particular error scenario, enabling users to trace the problem back to the source.

UnauthourizedError.value: You do not have access to this content. Please contact your system administrator.

post.description:
CyberArk Identity uses the API to initiate the user's authentication process. If the user exists then the response contains challenges.
- If the user does not have any challenges then the following message is returned: User does not have the attributes required to login.
- Contact CyberArk Support for more information.
- The request body must include the UUID attribute. CyberArk supports SMS, Email, OATH, Phone call, and Mobile Authenticator.

UUID.description: This is the UUID of the user whose identity the admin is trying to verify.

post.description:
Use this API to verify identity against CyberArk Identity.
- Once start authentication API is invoked and a user authentication session has been created successfully, the SendIdentityVerification API is invoked to further advance the user authentication process.
- SessionId and MechanismId returned as part of the “/startAuthentication” API are passed as request parameters to this API.
- Actions can be passed as one of the following options:
  startoob
  pool
  answer

Action.description:
Depending on the type of mechanism you are advancing, use one of the following actions:
* `Answer` (advance an in-band or answerable OOB mechanism)
* `StartOOB` (initiate an out-of-band mechanism)
* `Poll` (wait for a user to pass or fail an OOB mechanism)

Answer.description: This is the user-provided value to advance in-band or answerable 008 mechanisms. For example, a password, or OTP.

MechanismId.description: This is the mechanism ID you are advancing. This is provided in the [/CDirectoryService/StartAuthentication] response.

SessionId.description: The ID of the authentication session in which the mechanism was created. This is provided in the [/CDirectoryService/StartAuthentication].

TenantId.description: The tenant ID where the user is authenticating. This value should be consistent with the tenant used in the [/CDirectoryService/StartAuthentication].

Result.description: Return object for a successful API call.

ErrorID.description: Error ID if any error is received from the API. By default it is 'null'

ErrorCode.description: Error code if any error is received from the API. By default it is 'null'

Exception.description: Exception message if any exception is received from the API. By default it is 'null'

MessageID.description: Message Id for failure response. By default it is 'null'

Result.description: Unique Id of the created user.

InnerExceptions.description: Inner Exceptions if any received from the API. By default it is 'null'

Message.description: Error message for failure response. By default it is 'null'

success.description: It will be true for a successful API call.

IsSoftError.description: SoftError if true indicates this is not actually an exception but an UI warning popup.

Error.description: Error message text on failure.

UsernameNotAvailable.description: This error occurs when the given username is already present. By default, the below error message will be displayed: User name user@aak7736 is already in use. Please contact your IT helpdesk.

MissingParameter.description: This error occurs when the parameter mail id is not passed. By default, the below error message will be displayed: Parameter 'Mail' must be specified.

InvalidUsername.description: This error occurs when the given username is not in correct format. By default, the below error message will be displayed: User name is invalid; user names must be of the form 'name@suffix', not contain restricted characters, and suffix must match an existing User Service suffix..

Result.description: Return object for a successful API call

ErrorID.description: Error ID if any error is received from the API. By default, it is 'null'

ErrorCode.description: Error code if any error is received from the API. By default, it is 'null'

Exception.description: Exception message if an exception is received from the API. By default, it is 'null'

MessageID.description: Message Id for failure response. By default it is 'null'

Result.description: Result includes Count and Columns definition

ReturnID.description: ReturnID for the successful api call. By default it is null

Count.description: It is the number of records that the call returns

Columns.description: Array list of definition of all Columns

items.description: The object contains a list of column definition

TableKey.description: Specifies whether the column is a key and if so what kind of key it is. It can be a primary key or a foreign key. Ex: 'Primary'

Description.description: It is the brief description of the column. Ex: 'Row Identifier (primary key)'

Name.description: It is the name of the column

Format.description: Currently It is not applicable. By default it is null

TableName.description: It is the name of the table. By default it is null

DDName.description: It is the Data dictionary name of the column. Ex: 'ID'

DDTitle.description: It is the Data dictionary title of the column. Ex: 'ID'

Type.description: It is the numeric indicator of the type of data in the column. Ex: '12'

IsHidden.description: Specifies whether column is hidden or not. default: false

Width.description: Currently It is not applicable. By default it is 0

ForeignKey.description: Specifies whether column holds a foreign key or not. By default, it is null

Results.description: Results the rows/users details from the csv file

Entities.description: Array list of definition of all Columns

IsForeignKey.description: Specifies whether the entity has a foreign key or not. By default, it is false

Type.description: It is type of the entity. Ex: Application

Key.description: Unique Id of the Entity. Ex:'cb9b5761-6cfe-45a5-8ecf-ce9fa9e0ff82'

Row.description: Details of the user that is to be imported

Password.description: This is the password for the user and must meet the CyberArk Cloud Directory password requirements. Default: null

Roles.description: Role to be assigned for the user

Expiration Date.description: Expiration date for the user. Default: null

Require Password Change.description: Does the user require changing the password after the first login? Default: false

Email Address.description: Email address of the user. Ex: 'mark@email.com'

Description.description: Some information describing the user. Default: null

Display Name.description: Display name of user. Default: null

FullCount.description: It specifies number of maximum users that can be imported

InnerExceptions.description: Inner Exceptions if any received from the API. By default, it is 'null'

Message.description: Error message for failure response. By default it is 'null'

success.description: The success will be true or false

IsSoftError.description: SoftError if true indicates this is not an exception but a UI warning popup

Error.description: Error message text on failure, below message, will be returned if data present in the file is invalid

InvalidSuffix.description: When provided Table is empty or null, you would see this message 'User name 'temp@abc' has an invalid suffix - suffix must be one of the defined suffixes.'

InvalidFileFormat.description: When provided Table is empty or null, you would see this message 'Imported file temp is not a valid Excel or CSV file - The file extension is not currently supported.'

Result.description: Return object for a successful API call

ErrorID.description: Error ID if any error is received from the API. By default, it is 'null'

ErrorCode.description: Error code if any error is received from the API. By default, it is 'null'

Exception.description: Exception message if an exception is received from the API. By default, it is 'null'

MessageID.description: Message Id for failure response. By default it is 'null'

Result.description: The result for the API call. Ex: 'Your job for creating users has been submitted successfully. An email will be sent to you after the job has been completed.'

InnerExceptions.description: Inner Exceptions if any received from the API. By default, it is 'null'

Message.description: Error message for failure response. By default it is 'null'

success.description: It will be true for a successful API call

IsSoftError.description: SoftError if true indicates this is not an exception but a UI warning popup

Error.description: Error message text on failure, below message would be returned if file did not get uploaded

Result.description: Standard result

Error.description: Error message text on failure, may be null

Result.description: Return object for a successful API call

ErrorID.description: Error ID if any error is received from the API. By default, it is 'null'

ErrorCode.description: Error code if any error is received from the API. By default, it is 'null'

Exception.description: Exception message if an exception is received from the API. By default, it is 'null'

MessageID.description: Message Id for failure response. By default it is 'null'

Result.description: Result includes total count and details of all cloud users

Version.description: Version of the data being recieved. Ex: 1.0

DisplayName.description: Display name of user. Default: null

LastPasswordChangeDate.description: Date/time user last changed their password

InEverybodyRole.description: Is user in the Everybody role?

Mail.description: Email address of the user. Ex: 'mark@email.com'

Name.description: Username of the user. The username will be 'username@suffix' if suffix is required, else 'username'. Ex: 'mark@acme.inc'

InnerExceptions.description: Inner Exceptions if any received from the API. By default, it is 'null'

Message.description: Error message for failure response. By default it is 'null'

success.description: The success will be true or false

IsSoftError.description: SoftError if true indicates this is not an exception but a UI warning popup

Error.description: Error message text on failure, below message, would be returned if a user without administrative/user management permission is trying to fetch the detail of any other existing cloud user

UnauthorizedUser.description: You are not authorized to perform this operation. Please contact your IT helpdesk

Result.description: Return object for a successful API call.
The user information is returned as the response to the API

DirectoryServiceId.description: The unique ID for the directory service. This ID is created when at the time of the directory service integration with the CyberArk Identity. There is a unique ID available for CDS to.

ThirdPartyOathConfigured.description: Has a third party OATH token been configured for this user? - A Boolean flag that specifies if third-party OATH token has been configured for the user

ErrorID.description: Error ID if any error is received from the API. By default it is 'null'

HasPicture.description: Specifies if there is a picture available for this user in cloud directory service.

Settings.description: Contains internal state for the Portal Web UI; this property can be ignored.

SecurityKeyConfigured.description: Has the user configured a U2F Security Key?

EnablePurchasedLicenseMenu.description: Does the user have the right to view licenses?

PreferredCulture.description: User's preferred culture if any in culture code format (e.g. fr)

DisplayPreferredCulture.description: User's preferred culture if any in display format (e.g. French - français)

MfaSetupWizardSettings.description: Contains settings that guide MFA setup

PasswordExpDate.description: The expiry date-time of the user's password.

Exception.description: Exception message if any exception is received from the API. By default it is 'null'

LastLastLoginDate.description: Date-time user prior last logged in to the CyberArk Identity portal

DirectoryServiceLocalizedName.description: Directory service name localized to user's preferred language

Message.description: Error message for failure response. By default it is 'null'

DirectoryServiceType.description: The directory service type to which the user belongs. Ex- CDS (Cloud directory service).

IsSysAdmin.description: Specifies if the user is a system administrator.

SecurityQuestion.description: Specifies if any security question has been added to the user. The value will be 'yes' if the question is added. Else it will be 'null'.

IsSoftError.description: SoftError if true indicates this is not actually an exception but an UI warning popup.

CanChangePassword.description: A Boolean flag that specifies whether the user can change the password.

Id.description: The unique ID of the user. The unique ID is generated when the user is created.

SecurityQuestionsLastUpdate.description: Date-time user has last updated the security question

PasswordResetFlag.description:
An integer that specifies if the password reset is required for the user.

    The integer can be interpreted as below:
  • 0: no reset needed
  • 1: Reset required
  • 2: Reset optional
  • 3: Reset warning

PhonePinLastChangeDate.description: Date-time user last set their phone PIN

SqEnabled.description: Specifies if the security question MFA setup has been enabled for the user.

TenantId.description: The ID of the tenant to which the user belongs.

PasswordChangeSoftDays.description: Days before a user should be warned to change a near to expiring password

PasswordChangeHardHours.description: Hours before a user should be prompted to change an near to expiring password

TableKey.description: Specifies whether the column is a key and if so what kind of key it is. It can be a primary key or a foreign key. Ex: 'Primary'

Description.description: It is the brief description of the column. Ex: 'Row Identifier (primary key)'

Name.description: It is the name of the column

Format.description: Currently It is not applicable. By default it is null

IsHidden.description: Specifies whether column is hidden or not. default: false

Width.description: Currently It is not applicable. By default it is 0

ForeignKey.description: Specifies whether column holds a foreign key or not. By default, it is null

DisplayName.description: Display name of user. Default: null

Uuid.description: Unique Id of the user. Ex: 'cb9b5761-6cfe-45a5-8ecf-ce9fa9e0ff82'

StartDate.description: Start date for the user. Default: null

Mail.description: Email address of the user. Ex: 'mark@email.com'

EndDate.description: End date for the user. Default: null

Description.description: Some information describing the user. Default: null

Name.description: Username of the user. The username will be 'username@suffix' if suffix is required, else 'username'. Ex: 'mark@acme.inc'

FullCount.description: It specifies number of cloud users present currently

Result.description: The response object for the API call. The default value is 'null'.

Uuid.description: The unique ID of the user. For example, cb9b5761-6cfe-45a5-8ecf-ce9fa9e0gf86.

RiskLevel.description: This indicates the risk level of the user. For example, high, medium, or low.

Message.description: The error message for the failure response. By default, the failure response is 'null'.

MessageID.description: The message ID for the failure response. The default value is 'null'.

Exception.description: The exception message received from the API. The default value is 'null'.

ErrorId.description: The error ID received from the API. The default value is 'null'.

ErrorCode.description: The error code received from the API. The default value is 'null'.

IsSoftError.description: SoftError if true indicates this is not an exception but a UI warning popup.

InnerExceptions.description: Inner Exceptions if any received from the API. By default it is 'null'.

success.description: This is true for a successful API call.

State.description: This is the user state. For example, locked, enabled, or expired.

AllowForgotPassword.description: This Boolean flag indicates if the user should be displayed with a Forgot password link.

EndpointAuthenticationEnabled.description: This Boolean flag indicates if the endpoint authentication is enabled for the user.

properties.description: These client hints display on the Log-in form for the user.

Version.description: This is the version of the received data. For example, 1.0.

SessionId.description: This is a randomly generated ID used to identify the user session between the client and server. This ID is provided in the request body for advanced API authentication.

RetryWaitingTime.description: This is the retry waiting time.

SecurityImageName.description: This is the security image name.

AllowLoginMfaCache.description: This allows the MFA cache log in.

PromptSelectMech.description: This is the prompt for the selected mechanism. For example, If a password is the selected mechanism then this field value in the UI is \x93Password\x94.

PromptMechChosen.description: This is the prompt for the chosen mechanism. For example, if a password is the chosen mechanism then this field value in the UI is \x93Enter password\x94.

MechanismId.description: This is a randomly generated ID used to identity the mechanism. This ID is provided in the request body for the advanced API authentication.

AnwerType.description: This is the answer type for the given mechanism. For example, if a password is the mechanism then \x93AnswerType\x94 is \x93Answer\x94. If an email is the mechanism then \x93AnswerType\x94 is \x93start008\x94.

Name.description: This is the name of the MFA mechanism. For example, the name of the password mechanism is \x93UP\x94.

Mechanisms.description: This is the list of MFA mechanisms that a user can select and respond to.

Challenges.description: The challenges array contains multiple MFA mechanisms. The user must satisfy at least one mechanism to proceed.

TenantId.description: This is the tenant ID that the user is signing in to. If this field is not provided, the tenant must be identified by the user suffix or the requested URL.

I18nMessageType.description: This is the message type. For example, none, error, warning, information.

ResultAppliesTo.description: This is the mechanism ID that is mapped with an MFA package. The default is null.
